post.summary: Test if dns servers are reachable.

get.summary: Get the ordered list of firewall rules. Within the list of traffic rules, rules are processed in order of appearance, from top to bottom. When a connection matches a firewall rule, further processing for the connection stops, and the appliance ignores any additional firewall rules you have set.

put.summary:
Set the ordered list of firewall rules to allow or deny traffic from one or more incoming IP addresses. This overwrites the existing firewall rules and creates a new rule list. Within the list of traffic rules, rules are processed in order of appearance, from top to bottom. For example, the list of rules can be as follows:
AddressPrefixInterface NamePolicy
10.112.0.10*REJECT
10.112.0.10nic0ACCEPT
In the above example, the first rule drops all packets originating from 10.112.0.1 and
the second rule accepts all packets originating from 10.112.0.1 only on nic0. In effect, the second rule is always ignored which is not desired, hence the order has to be swapped. When a connection matches a firewall rule, further processing for the connection stops, and the appliance ignores any additional firewall rules you have set.

get.summary: Returns servers for which no proxy configuration will be applied.

200.description: List of servers for which no proxy configuration will be applied.

put.summary: Sets servers for which no proxy configuration should be applied. This operation sets environment variables. In order for this operation to take effect, a logout from appliance or a service restart is required. If IPv4 is enabled, "127.0.0.1" and "localhost" will always bypass the proxy (even if they are not explicitly configured).

get.summary: Gets proxy configuration for all configured protocols.

200.description: Proxy configuration for all configured protocols.

delete.summary: Deletes a proxy configuration for a specific protocol.

parameters.description: ID whose proxy is to be deleted.
parameters.name: protocol

get.summary: Gets the proxy configuration for a specific protocol.

parameters.description: The protocol whose proxy configuration is requested.
parameters.name: protocol

200.description: Proxy configuration for a specific protocol.

put.summary: Configures which proxy server to use for the specified protocol. This operation sets environment variables for using proxy. In order for this configuration to take effect a logout / service restart is required.

parameters.description: The protocol for which proxy should be set.
parameters.name: protocol

post.summary: Tests a proxy configuration by testing the connection to the proxy server and test host.

parameters.description: Protocol whose proxy is to be tested.
parameters.name: protocol

post.summary: Changes the Hostname/IP of the management network of vCenter appliance. The Hostname/IP change invokes the PNID change process which involves LDAP entry modification, updating registry entries, configuration files modification and network configuration changes. vCenter server is expected to be down for few minutes during these changes

400.description: if another change task is in progress

401.description: if the user is not authenticated.

post.summary: Reset and restarts network configuration on all interfaces, also this will renew the DHCP lease for DHCP IP address.

get.summary: Get the NTP configuration status. If you run the 'timesync.get' command, you can retrieve the current time synchronization method (NTP- or VMware Tools-based). The 'ntp' command always returns the NTP server information, even when the time synchronization mode is not set to NTP. If the time synchronization mode is not NTP-based, the NTP server status is displayed as down.

put.summary: Set NTP servers. This method updates old NTP servers from configuration and sets the input NTP servers in the configuration. If NTP based time synchronization is used internally, the NTP daemon will be restarted to reload given NTP configuration. In case NTP based time synchronization is not used, this method only replaces servers in the NTP configuration.

post.summary: Test the connection to a list of ntp servers.

info.description: The vCenter Server Appliance is a preconfigured Linux-based virtual machine optimized for running vCenter Server and associated services.

timeout.description: The timeout (in seconds) specifies how long you enable the Shell access. The maximum timeout is 86400 seconds(1 day).

enabled.description: Enabled can be set to true or false

password_expires_at.description: Date when the account's password will expire

max_days.description: Maximum number of days a password may be used. If the password is older than this, a password change will be forced.

warn_days.description: Number of days warning given before a password expires. A zero means warning is given only upon the day of expiration.

min_days.description: Minimum number of days allowed between password changes. Any password changes attempted sooner than this will be rejected.

min_days_between_password_change.description: Minimum number of days between password change

days_after_password_expiration.description: Number of days after password expiration before the account will be locked

protocol.description: Transport protocol used to forward log messages.

port.description: The port on which the remote logging server is listening for forwarded log messages.

hostname.description: FQDN or IP address of the logging server to which messages are forwarded.

message.description: Message associated with the state of the configured remote logging server.

state.description: State of the configured remote logging server.

hostname.description: FQDN or IP address of the configured remote logging servers.

com.vmware.appliance.logging.forwarding..description: The {@name State} {@term enumerated type} defines the state values that a remote logging server can be in.
The {@name Protocol} {@term enumerated type} defines transport protocols for outbound log messages.

cfg_list.description: The cfgList is a list of Config structure that contains the log message forwarding rules in terms of the host, port, protocol of the log message.

send_test_message.description: Flag specifying whether a default test message should be sent to the configured logging servers.

com.vmware.appliance.monitoring.function.description: {@name FunctionType} {@term enumerated type} Defines aggregation function

com.vmware.appliance.monitoring.interval.description: {@name IntervalType} {@term enumerated type} Defines interval between the values in hours and mins,                    for which aggregation will apply

id.description: monitored item ID Ex: CPU, MEMORY

name.description: monitored item name Ex: "Network write speed"

interval.description: interval between values in hours, minutes

name.description: Monitored item IDs Ex: CPU, MEMORY, STORAGE_TOTAL

com.vmware.appliance.networking.DNS_info.description: The {@name DnsMode} {@term enumerated type} describes the source of DNS servers.

hostname.description: New hostname to assign to the management network of vCenter appliance

dns.description: DNS Configuration to set for the machine

ipv4.description: IPv4 Configuration to set for the machine

ipv6.description: IPv6 Configuration to set for the machine

com.vmware.appliance.networking.dns.host.description: {@name MessageStatus} {@term enumerated type} Individual test result

messages.description: messages

mode.description: Define how to determine the DNS servers. Leave the servers argument empty if the mode argument is "DHCP". Set the servers argument to a comma-separated list of DNS servers if the mode argument is "static". The DNS server are assigned from the specified list.

servers.description: List of the currently used DNS servers.

com.vmware.appliance.networking.dns.serv.description: {@name DNSServerMode} {@term enumerated type} Describes DNS Server source (DHCP,static)
{@name MessageStatus} {@term enumerated type} Individual test result

messages.description: messages

com.vmware.appliance.networking.firewall.description: {@name Policy} {@term enumerated type} Defines firewall rule policies.

prefix.description: CIDR prefix used to mask address. For example, an IPv4 prefix of 24 ignores the low-order 8 bits of address.

policy.description: The allow or deny policy of this rule.

interface_name.description: The interface to which this rule applies. An empty string indicates that the rule applies to all interfaces.

interfaces.description: Interface configuration as a key-value map where key is a network interface name, for example, "nic0".

com.vmware.appliance.networking.interfac.description: {@name InterfaceStatus} {@term enumerated type} Defines interface status

prefix.description: The IPv4 CIDR prefix, for example, 24.  See http://www.oav.net/mirrors/cidr.html for netmask-to-prefix conversion.

default_gateway.description: The IPv4 address of the default gateway. This configures the global default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

prefix.description: The IPv4 CIDR prefix, for example, 24.  See http://www.oav.net/mirrors/cidr.html for netmask-to-prefix conversion.

configurable.description: The specified network interface is configurable or not.

default_gateway.description: The IPv4 address of the default gateway. This configures the global default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

com.vmware.appliance.networking.interfac.description: The {@name Mode} {@term enumerated type} defines different IPv4 address assignment modes.

config.description: The IPv4 Network configuration to set.

prefix.description: The IPv6 CIDR prefix, for example, 64.

address.description: The IPv6 address, for example, fc00:10:20:83:20c:29ff:fe94:bb5a.

prefix.description: The IPv6 CIDR prefix, for example, 64.

origin.description: The Origin of the IPv6 address. For more information, see RFC 4293.

status.description: The Status of the IPv6 address. For more information, see RFC 4293.

address.description: The IPv6 address, for example, fc00:10:20:83:20c:29ff:fe94:bb5a.

addresses.description: The list of addresses to be statically assigned.

dhcp.description: An address will be assigned by a DHCP server.

default_gateway.description: The default gateway for static IP address assignment. This configures the global IPv6 default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

autoconf.description: An address will be assigned by Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC).

addresses.description: List of addresses with their origins and statuses.

default_gateway.description: The default gateway for static IP address assignment. This configures the global IPv6 default gateway on the appliance with the specified gateway address and interface. This gateway replaces the existing default gateway configured on the appliance. However, if the gateway address is link-local, then it is added for that interface. This does not support configuration of multiple global default gateways through different interfaces.

com.vmware.appliance.networking.interfac.description: The {@name Origin} {@term enumerated type} defines IPv6 address origin values.
The {@name Status} {@term enumerated type} defines IPv6 address status values. See RFC 4293.

servers.description: List of strings representing servers to bypass proxy. A server can be a FQDN, IP address, FQDN:port or IP:port combinations.

enabled.description: In the result of the {@name #get} and {@name #list} {@term operations} this {@term field} indicates whether proxying is enabled for a particular protocol. In the input to the {@name test} and {@name set} {@term operations} this {@term field} specifies whether proxying should be enabled for a particular protocol.

port.description: Port to connect to the proxy server. In a 'get' call, indicates the port connected to the proxy server. In a 'set' call, specifies the port to connect to the proxy server. A value of -1 indicates the default port.

server.description: Hostname or IP address of the proxy server.

com.vmware.appliance.networking.proxy.pr.description: {@name Protocol} {@term enumerated type} defines the protocols for which proxying is supported.

com.vmware.appliance.networking.proxy.se.description: {@name ServerStatus} {@term enumerated type} defines the status of the server associated with the test run.

status.description: Status of the proxy server indicating whether the proxy server is reachable.

config.description: Proxy configuration for the specific protocol.

host.description: A hostname, IPv4 or Ipv6 address.

spec.description: Information required to change the hostname.
update spec with optional boolean value

time.description: The time the notification was raised/found.

com.vmware.appliance.ntp.server_status.description: {@name ServerStatus} {@term enumerated type} Status of server during test

server.description: Server name associated with the test run.

servers.description: List of host names or ip addresses of ntp servers.
List of host names or IP addresses of NTP servers.

parts.description: a list of optional parts. Run backup parts APIs to get list of optional parts and description

backup_password.description: a password for a backup piece The backupPassword must adhere to the following password requirements: At least 8 characters, cannot be more than 20 characters in length. At least 1 uppercase letter. At least 1 lowercase letter. At least 1 numeric digit. At least 1 special character (i.e. any character not in [0-9,a-z,A-Z]). Only visible ASCII characters (for example, no space).

state.description: The state of the backup job.

messages.description: List of messages.

progress.description: Progress of the job in percentage.

end_time.description: Time when the backup was finished.

start_time.description: Time when the backup was started.

parts.description: List of optional parts that will be included in the backup. Use the {@link com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.Parts#list} {@term operation} to get information about the supported parts.

comment.description: Custom comment provided by the user.

location.description: Path or URL of the backup location.

backup_password.description: Password for a backup piece. The backupPassword must adhere to the following password requirements: At least 8 characters, cannot be more than 20 characters in length. At least 1 uppercase letter. At least 1 lowercase letter. At least 1 numeric digit. At least 1 special character (i.e. any character not in [0-9,a-z,A-Z]). Only visible ASCII characters (for example, no space).

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.job.description: The {@name BackupRestoreProcessState} {@term enumerated type} defines the possible states of a backup/restore process.

version_name.description: Appliance product type, for example 6.8.2 GA

jobs.description: Identifiers of backup jobs that can match the filter.

type.description: Type of the backup job. Indicates whether the backup was started manually or as a scheduled backup.

user.description: Name of the user who performed the operation.

duration.description: Time in seconds since the backup job was started or the time it took to complete the backup job.

operation.description: Identifier of the operation associated with the task.

messages.description: List of any info/warning/error messages returned by the backup job.

description.description: Description of the operation associated with the task.

size.description: Size of the backup data transferred to remote location.

end_time.description: Time when the operation is completed.

location_user.description: The username for the remote backup location.

target.description: Identifier of the target created by the operation or an existing one the operation performed on.

build.description: Information about the build of the appliance.

cancelable.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

status.description: Status of the operation associated with the task.

start_time.description: Time when the operation is started.

service.description: Identifier of the service containing the operation.

error.description: Description of the error if the operation status is "FAILED".

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.job.description: The {@name Type} {@term enumerated type} defines the type of backup job.
The {@name LocationType} {@term enumerated type} defines the type of destination location for backup/restore. You specify the location type when you create a backup job. See {@link BackupRequest}.

messages.description: List of messages.

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.job.description: The {@name ReturnStatus} {@term enumerated type} defines the return type for the cancel operation. You specify the return status when you return the result of cancel job. See {@link ReturnResult}.

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.loc.description: {@name LocationType} {@term enumerated type} Defines type of all locations for backup/restore

description.description: part description id in message bundle

name.description: part name id in message bundle

selected_by_default.description: Is this part selected by default in the user interface.

messages.description: List of messages

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.ret.description: {@name ReturnStatus} {@term enumerated type} Defines the state of precheck

parts.description: List of optional parts to be backed up. Use the {@link com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.Parts#list} {@term operation} to get information about the supported parts.

backup_password.description: Password for a backup piece. The backupPassword must adhere to the following password requirements: At least 8 characters, cannot be more than 20 characters in length. At least 1 uppercase letter. At least 1 lowercase letter. At least 1 numeric digit. At least 1 special character (i.e. any character not in [0-9,a-z,A-Z]). Only visible ASCII characters (for example, no space).

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.sch.description: The {@name DayOfWeek} {@term enumerated type} defines the set of days when backup can be scheduled. The days can be specified as a list of individual days. You specify the days when you set the recurrence for a schedule. See {@link RecurrenceInfo#days}.

parts.description: List of optional parts that will be included in backups based on this schedule details. Use the {@link com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.Parts#list} {@term operation} to get information about the supported parts.

enable.description: Enable or disable a schedule, by default when created a schedule will be enabled.

hour.description: Hour when backup should run. The hour should be specified in 24-hour clock format.

days.description: Day of week when the backup should be run. Days can be specified as list of days.

max_count.description: Number of backups which should be retained. If retention is not set, all the backups will be retained forever.

parts.description: List of optional parts. Use the {@link com.vmware.appliance.recovery.backup.Parts#list} {@term operation} to get information about the supported parts.

backup_password.description: Password for a backup piece. The backupPassword must adhere to the following password requirements: At least 8 characters, cannot be more than 20 characters in length. At least 1 uppercase letter. At least 1 lowercase letter. At least 1 numeric digit. At least 1 special character (i.e. any character not in [0-9,a-z,A-Z]). Only visible ASCII characters (for example, no space).

comment.description: field that specifies the description for the backup.

parts.description: List of parts included in the backup.

timestamp.description: Time when this backup was completed.

system_name.description: The system name identifier of the appliance represented by the backup.

version.description: The version of the appliance represented by the backup.

comment.description: Custom comment added by the user for this backup.
Custom comment added by the user for this backup.

version.description: The version of the appliance represented by the backup archive.

timestamp.description: Time when this backup was started.

supported.description: Is recovery supported in this appliance.

ignore_warnings.description: Flag indicating whether warnings should be ignored during reconciliation.

cancelable.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

operation.description: Name of the operation associated with the task.

messages.description: A list of localized messages.

progress.description: The progress of the job as a percentage.

description.description: Description of the operation associated with the task.

error.description: Description of the error if the operation status is "FAILED".

end_time.description: Time when the operation is completed.

target.description: Identifier of the target resource the operation modifies.

status.description: Status of the operation associated with the task.

service.description: Name of the service containing the operation.

start_time.description: Time when the operation is started.

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.reconcilia.description: The {@name Status} {@term enumerated type} defines the status values that can be reported for an operation.

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.restore.jo.description: {@name BackupRestoreProcessState} {@term enumerated type} Defines state of backup/restore process
{@name LocationType} {@term enumerated type} Defines type of all locations for backup/restore

messages.description: list of messages

ignore_warnings.description: The flag to ignore warnings during restore

backup_password.description: a password for a backup piece

sso_admin_user_password.description: The password for SSO admin user.

messages.description: List of messages

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.restore.jo.description: {@name ReturnStatus} {@term enumerated type} Defines the state of precheck

com.vmware.appliance.recovery.restore.lo.description: {@name LocationType} {@term enumerated type} Defines type of all locations for backup/restore

parts.description: List of parts included in the backup.

timestamp.description: Time when this backup was completed.

messages.description: Any messages if the backup is not aplicable

applicable.description: Does the VCSA match the deployment type, network properties            and version of backed up VC

boxname.description: Box name is PNID/ FQDN etc

sso_login_required.description: Is SSO login required for the vCenter server.

backup_password.description: a password for a backup piece

sso_admin_user_password.description: The password for SSO admin user.

com.vmware.appliance.services.state.description: The {@name State} {@term enumerated type} defines valid Run State for services.

reason.description: The reason behind the shutdown action

action.description: The pending shutdown operation. The string values for pending operations can be 'poweroff', 'reboot' or ''.

delay.description: Minutes after which poweroff should start. If 0 is specified, poweroff will start immediately.
Minutes after which reboot should start. If 0 is specified, reboot will start immediately.

user.description: Name of the user who performed the operation.

result.description: Result of the operation. If an operation reports partial results before it completes, this {@term field} could be {@term set} before the {@link CommonInfo#status} has the value {@link Status#SUCCEEDED}. The value could change as the operation progresses.

operation.description: Identifier of the operation associated with the task.

description.description: Description of the operation associated with the task.

error.description: Description of the error if the operation status is "FAILED".

end_time.description: Time when the operation is completed.

target.description: Identifier of the target created by the operation or an existing one the operation performed on.

cancelable.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

status.description: Status of the operation associated with the task.

service.description: Identifier of the service containing the operation.

start_time.description: Time when the operation is started.

new_size.description: Nedw size of the partition in MB.

old_size.description: Original size of the partition in MB.

disk.description: The disk number in the vSphere Web Client.

type.description: Type of product. Same product can have different deployment options, which is represented by type.

summary.description: Summary of patch (empty string, if the appliance has not been patched)

install_time.description: Display the date and time when this system was first installed. Value will not change on subsequent updates.

releasedate.description: Release date of patch (empty string, if the appliance has not been patched)

user.description: Name of the user who performed the operation.

cancelable.description: Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

operation.description: Identifier of the operation associated with the task.

subtasks.description: Information about the subtasks that this appliance task consists of.

description.description: Description of the operation associated with the task.

subtask_order.description: List of tasks that make up this appliance task in the order they are being run.

error.description: Description of the error if the operation status is "FAILED".

end_time.description: Time when the operation is completed.

target.description: Identifier of the target created by the operation or an existing one the operation performed on.

status.description: Status of the operation associated with the task.

service.description: Identifier of the service containing the operation.

start_time.description: Time when the operation is started.

com.vmware.appliance.timesync.time_sync_.description: The {@name TimeSyncMode} {@term enumerated type} defines time synchronization modes

com.vmware.appliance.update.common_info..description: The {@name Category} {@term enumerated type} defines update type
The {@name Priority} {@term enumerated type} defines the update installation priority recommendations.
The {@name Severity} {@term enumerated type} defines the severity of the issues fixed in the update.

task.description: The running or completed update task.

version.description: Version of base appliance if state is UP_TO_DATE Version of update being staged or installed if state is INSTALL_IN_PROGRESS or STAGE_IN_PROGRESS Version of update staged if state is UPDATES_PENDING Version of update failed if state is INSTALL_FAILED or ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS

latest_query_time.description: Timestamp of latest query to update repository.

size.description: Download Size of update in Megabytes.

reboot_required.description: Flag indicating whether reboot is required after update.

description.description: Description of the update. The short information what this update is. E.g. "Update2 for vCenter Server Appliance 6.5"

services_will_be_stopped.description: List of the services that will be stopped and restarted during the update installation.

contents.description: List of the 1. issues addressed since previous/current version 2. new features/improvements

eulas.description: List of EULAs. This list has multiple entries and can be dynamic based on what we are actually installing.

check_time.description: Time when this precheck was run

estimated_time_to_rollback.description: Rough estimate of time to rollback the update (minutes).

estimated_time_to_install.description: Rough estimate of time to install the update (minutes).

issues.description: Lists of the issues and warnings

questions.description: List of questions that must be answered to install the update.

reboot_required.description: Is reboot required to install the update.

type.description: How this field shoudl be represented in GUI or CLI

text.description: Label for the item to be used in GUI/CLI

com.vmware.appliance.update.pending.ques.description: The {@name InputType} {@term enumerated type} defines representation of field fields in GUI or CLI

user_data.description: map of user provided data with IDs
map of user provided data with IDs
map of user provided data with IDs

auto_stage.description: Automatically stage the latest update if available.

check_schedule.description: Schedule when the automatic check will be run.

com.vmware.appliance.update.policy.day_o.description: The {@name DayOfWeek} {@term enumerated type} defines the set of days

auto_stage.description: Automatically stage the latest update if available.

check_schedule.description: Schedule when the automatic check will be run.

auto_update.description: Is the appliance updated automatically. If {@term set} the appliance may ignore the check schedule or auto-stage settings.

default_URL.description: Current appliance update default repository URL.

custom_URL.description: Current appliance update custom repository URL.

manual_control.description: Whether API client should allow the user to start update manually

policy.description: Info structure containing the policy for the appliance update.

size.description: Download Size of update in Megabytes.

description.description: Description of the update. The short information what this update is. E.g. "Update2 for vCenter Server Appliance 6.5"

version.description: Version in form of X.Y.Z.P. e.g. 6.5.1.5400

reboot_required.description: Flag indicating whether reboot is required after update.

com.vmware.appliance.update.state.description: The {@name State} {@term enumerated type} defines the various states the appliance update can be in.

size.description: Download Size of update in Megabytes.

description.description: Description of the update. The short information what this update is. E.g. "Update2 for vCenter Server Appliance 6.5"

version.description: Version in form of X.Y.Z.P. e.g. 6.5.1.5400

reboot_required.description: Flag indicating whether reboot is required after update.

com.vmware.appliance.vmon.service.health.description: The Service.Health enumerated type defines the possible values for health of a service.

description_key.description: Service description key. Can be used to lookup resource bundle

name_key.description: Service name key. Can be used to lookup resource bundle

health.description:
Health of service.
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Service.Info.state is STARTED.

health_messages.description:
Localizable messages associated with the health of the service
This field is optional and it is only relevant when the value of Service.Info.state is STARTED.

com.vmware.appliance.vmon.service.startu.description: The Service.StartupType enumerated type defines valid Startup Type for services managed by vMon.

com.vmware.appliance.vmon.service.state.description: The Service.State enumerated type defines valid Run State for services.

startup_type.description:
Startup Type
If unspecified, leaves value unchanged.

total.description: Total amount of the work for the operation.

completed.description: The amount of work completed for the operation. The value can only be incremented.

com.vmware.cis.task.status.description: The Status enumerated type defines the status values that can be reported for an operation.

type.description:
The type of resource being identified (for example {@code com.acme.Person}).

{@term Services} that contain {@term operations} for creating and deleting resources typically contain a {@term constant} specifying the resource type for the resources being created and deleted. The API metamodel metadata {@term services} include a {@term service} that allows retrieving all the known resource types.

id.description: The identifier for a resource whose type is specified by {@link #type}.

error_type.description: Discriminator field to help API consumers identify the structure type.

data.description:
Data to facilitate clients responding to the {@term operation} reporting a standard {@term error} to indicating that it was unable to complete successfully.

{@term Operations} may provide data that clients can use when responding to {@term errors}. Since the data that clients need may be specific to the context of the {@term operation} reporting the {@term error}, different {@term operations} that report the same {@term error} may provide different data in the {@term error}. The documentation for each each {@term operation} will describe what, if any, data it provides for each {@term error} it reports. The {@link ArgumentLocations}, {@link FileLocations}, and {@link TransientIndication} {@term structures} are intended as possible values for this {@term field}. {@link com.vmware.vapi.std.DynamicID} may also be useful as a value for this {@term field} (although that is not its primary purpose). Some {@term services} may provide their own specific {@term structures} for use as the value of this {@term field} when reporting {@term errors} from their {@term operations}.

messages.description:
Stack of one or more localizable messages for human {@term error} consumers.

The message at the top of the stack (first in the list) describes the {@term error} from the perspective of the {@term operation} the client invoked. Each subsequent message in the stack describes the "cause" of the prior message.

error_type.description: Discriminator field to help API consumers identify the structure type.

error_type.description: Discriminator field to help API consumers identify the structure type.

data.description:
Data to facilitate clients responding to the {@term operation} reporting a standard {@term error} to indicating that it was unable to complete successfully.

{@term Operations} may provide data that clients can use when responding to {@term errors}. Since the data that clients need may be specific to the context of the {@term operation} reporting the {@term error}, different {@term operations} that report the same {@term error} may provide different data in the {@term error}. The documentation for each each {@term operation} will describe what, if any, data it provides for each {@term error} it reports. The {@link ArgumentLocations}, {@link FileLocations}, and {@link TransientIndication} {@term structures} are intended as possible values for this {@term field}. {@link com.vmware.vapi.std.DynamicID} may also be useful as a value for this {@term field} (although that is not its primary purpose). Some {@term services} may provide their own specific {@term structures} for use as the value of this {@term field} when reporting {@term errors} from their {@term operations}.

messages.description:
Stack of one or more localizable messages for human {@term error} consumers.

The message at the top of the stack (first in the list) describes the {@term error} from the perspective of the {@term operation} the client invoked. Each subsequent message in the stack describes the "cause" of the prior message.

Since the data that clients need may be specific to the context of the {@term operation} reporting the {@term error}, different {@term operations} that report the same {@term error} may provide different data in the {@term error}. The message at the top of the stack (first in the list) describes the {@term error} from the perspective of the {@term operation} the client invoked. Each subsequent message in the stack describes the "cause" of the prior message.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the localizable string or message template.

This identifier is typically used to retrieve a locale-specific string or message template from a message catalog.

default_message.description: The value of this localizable string or message template in the {@code en_US} (English) locale.  If {@link #id} refers to a message template, the default message will contain the substituted arguments. This value can be used by clients that do not need to display strings and messages in the native language of the user.  It could also be used as a fallback if a client is unable to access the appropriate message catalog.

args.description: Positional arguments to be substituted into the message template. This list will be empty if the message uses named arguments or has no arguments.
